name: TFS4JIRA

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
TFS4JIRA 5.2 is a very important release which brings a number of highly requested improvements. Specifically:

  • the commits are scanned in parts and most recent git changes are fetched first
  • we added a feature to fetch repository names to select them from the list during profile configuration
  • git scans are now performed by parallel threads
  • we have improved, simplified and optimized the UI in several places
  • we added an option to disable HTML to JIRA wiki markup conversion for descriptions, and other rich text fields
  • we have performed a massive code refactoring, removed older libraries and replaced them with modern solutions
  • we have migrated the solution to .NET 4.5 and refreshed the installer package

We have also resolved numerous bugs.

If you feel like sharing your opinions on using TFS4JIRA please send us an email to support@spartez.com. And if you like our product please do not hesitate to leave a review on Atlassian Marketplace.

Enjoy TFS4JIRA 5.2!

name: PDF View Plugin for JIRA (PDF Exporter)

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
Scalability

We refactored the PDF document renderer from an everything-in-memory to a streaming architecture, resulting in drastic performance improvements. 25-50K issues can be exported to complex, tens-of-thousands-of-pages documents. We also updated the following document templates to scale better to large data sets (faster and using less memory):

  • issue-fo.vm
  • issue-navigator-fo.vm
  • gantt-chart-fo.vm
  • requirement-specification-fo.vm
  • story-card-fo.vm

Error tolerance

The robustness of the exported logic was vastly improved to deal with unexpected HTML and XML. It can handle unknown elements, unknown attributes, unknown CSS styling, and every sort of syntax errors. If you are maintaining or migrating field values in HTML, this will save you lots of headache.

Expressions Reference Manual

Want to export field X of object Y? Use this new template both as cheatsheet and as testing environment.

Bugfixes:

  • Front-end does not conflict with the Zendesk Connector add-on

name: SCM Activity for JIRA

version.releaseNotes:
This plugin separates SCM Change-Set data from JIRA, as a result it increases Issue loading performance by avoiding issue comments or change-set custom fields and less database growth. It loads SCM change-set data only on SCM Activity tab click.

- Easy maintenance and high availability of JIRA instance due to less database growth/size

- This plugin captures the results of the SCM change-sets in the JIRA issue Activity section. The Change-set details are not written to the JIRA comment section resulting in a cleaner, more efficiently performing JIRA system.

- This plugin provides JQL Search functions namely scmSearch() and scmActivitySearch() to search SCM activities by file name or author or branch or tag and change text message ..etc

- Easy to generate Release Notes, since this plugin provides REST Interface to post or fetch change-set details

- External jobs integration

- Supports multiple SCM systems

name: Commit Policy Plugin for JIRA (Git, SVN)

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
Token-based authentication

This new authentication mode, based on security tokens instead of plain text passwords, greatly improves hook security.

Git client-side verifications (commit-msg hook)

Reject broken commits before those are actually made! This mechanism verifies the commits in the developers' clone at commit time.

Support for Bitbucket Cloud & GitHub

Verify commits locally even if the remote repository is hosted in a closed system, where you cannot configure hooks.

Hook Script Wizard

The redesigned interface makes hook script installation a breeze.

"$committer.userName" variable

This variable in JQL conditions will be replaced with the committer's username before the JQL search is executed. Example JQL: "assignee = $committer.username"

Improvements

  • Execute permission "x" is auto-set for hook script files (on U*X)

Bugfixes

  • VisualSVN permission problems fixed
  • All condition types obey file path based scope limiting
  • International character fixes on Windows (files and usernames)

name: Catch-to-JIRA Workflow Extension

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through the vendor's website.

version.releaseNotes: JIRA is the business when it comes to requirements capture and defect management. With the Catch-to-JIRA Workflow Extension, Enterprise Tester supports full bi-directional synchronization of JIRA requirements/user stories and issues.The Catch-to-JIRA Workflow Extension accelerates the utility of an already pretty snazzy API and native capability to allow: configurable import filtering by type, status, priorities, JQL fragments, components, affected version(s), fix version(s); optional sub-task synchronization; configurable synchronization schedules â adhoc (manual), periodic (set time interval) and daily; custom field support; JIRA ID on the requirement in Enterprise Tester; remote links to the Requirement in Enterprise Tester (and test script when linked) added on the JIRA User Story, and; JIRA workflow transition support from Enterprise Tester.

name: Gallifrey

version.releaseNotes:
Features:

  • When adding locked timers, prompts if you want to add to running timer
  • Added link to Gitter for chat help
  • Added Copy/Paste functionality to timers to get jira ref and add new timer with same ref
  • Updated some keyboard shortcuts
  • Show all dates even if no timers for that date
  • Added temporary timers for logging purpose when you don't have a Jira reference to hand
  • Ability to add lock time to an existing timer or recent reference
  • Added bulk export when clicking unexported time notice or multi selecting timers
  • Ability to add export comments as a standard comment as well as worklog comment

Bug Fixes

  • Fix issue for exported timers resetting to un-exported
  • Round locked timers to nearest minute as seconds are not logged anyway
  • Updated the order of default search results
  • Fixed issue with getting an idle timer after it's auto purged
  • Fixed issue with changing timer date when running
  • Auto update check now doesn't run when a flyout is open
  • Keyboard shortcuts only active when flyout not open

instructions.body: Installer is "Click-Once" so should install and update itself.

name: StopWatch for JIRA

version.releaseNotes:
Important improvement:

Previous versions of Jira StopWatch fetches the filter-list and issue-list once every 30 seconds. It came to my attention, that this could overload the Jira servers if many people are using StopWatch.

From this version forward, both the filter-list and issue-list will only be fetched on-demand, ie. when the dropdown boxes are actually opened.

name: Risk Register

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
Bug fixes in version 3.0.1:

  • Fixed: exposure not appearing in JIRA Issues gadget in Confluence
  • Fixed: risk issue type mistakenly added to default issue type scheme
  • Fixed: project picker includes projects that already have a risk register
  • Fixed: project picker spins endlessly if there are no projects

(Version 3.0.0) Makes risk management easier for organizations that have finer-grained risk models. It also integrates risks more seamlessly into the Issue Navigator.

New features:

  • Changing the risk model: make your matrix 4x4, 5x5, 3x6, or any dimensions you like.
  • Use Exposure as a term in your issue search filters, and get risk statistics by Exposure.
  • Manifest: a diagnostic tool that shows behind-the-scenes configuration data

instructions.body: For MacOSX its quite easy. Download the DMG, double click it and drag the WT4 icon to the "Applications" folder. * App can be run from Spotlight by typing "WT4" * Using "Launchpad" and clicking on the "WT4" * Using "Finder": Go to "Applications" > "WT4"

For windows there are a bit more steps. Download EXE file, double click it to run the installer. There may be additional windows that you may be asked if you want to run the installer. Simply click "Run", or "Yes". When the installation window runs, click "Install" to begin installation.    After installation completes. App can be run: * There should be a shortcut in the desktop with "WT4" title * Typing "WT4" in search bar when pressing "Start"

name: R4J - Requirements Management for JIRA

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
The coverage view has been reworked to include more information and to be more flexible. In addition to the previous configuration options, you can now define your own filter using Atlassian's JQL language and define custom labels for each column.

We have added the option to use JQL to define custom filters for both the traceability matrix as well as the "add existing issue" dialog. Be more efficient by creating filters on demand!

In addition, you can now change the link type of an issue link so you don't need to delete and re-create a link anymore!

Last but not least there is a lot of fine-tuning in the back-end to give you an improved experience with Requirements for JIRA.
